com.frdfsnlght.transporter.api

Enum SpawnDirection

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<SpawnDirection>
      • com.frdfsnlght.transporter.api.SpawnDirection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<SpawnDirection>

    public enum SpawnDirection
extends java.lang.Enum<SpawnDirection>
    Specifies directions a LocalAreaGate will spawn and arriving player.

    The final direction a player is facing when exiting a gate is determined by a number of factors, spawn direction being one of them. See the wiki page on Designs for more information about how the final direction is determined.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      EAST
      Spawn facing east.
      EAST_NORTH_EAST
      Spawn facing east-north-east.
      EAST_SOUTH_EAST
      Spawn facing east-south-east.
      FORWARD
      Spawn facing "forward" relative to the gate's direction.
      NORTH
      Spawn facing north.
      NORTH_EAST
      Spawn facing north-east.
      NORTH_NORTH_EAST
      Spawn facing north-north-east.
      NORTH_NORTH_WEST
      Spawn facing north-north-west.
      NORTH_WEST
      Spawn facing north-west.
      PLAYER
      Spawn facing the same direction the player faced when they entered the sending gate.
      RANDOM
      Spawn facing a random direction.
      REVERSE
      Spawn facing "backwards" relative to the gate's direction.
      SOUTH
      Spawn facing south.
      SOUTH_EAST
      Spawn facing south-east.
      SOUTH_SOUTH_EAST
      Spawn facing east-south-east.
      SOUTH_SOUTH_WEST
      Spawn facing south-west.
      SOUTH_WEST
      Spawn facing south-south-east.
      WEST
      Spawn facing west.
      WEST_NORTH_WEST
      Spawn facing west-north-west.
      WEST_SOUTH_WEST
      Spawn facing west-south-west.
